author: Get News
title: Pathlight Seniorcare Services Reinforces Its Commitment to Senior Care in Mountain Brook, AL | observernewsonline.com
text:
Pathlight Seniorcare Services in Mountain Brook, AL, reaffirms its commitment to providing exceptional home care for seniors. Tailored to enhance comfort and well-being, their personalized care plans ensure seniors live fulfilling lives with dignity. For top-quality senior care, visit https://pathlightseniorcare.com Mountain Brook, AL - Pathlight Seniorcare Services, a prominent figure in senior care, today reaffirmed its commitment to the residents of Mountain Brook, AL, by continuing to offer unparalleled home care services. This announcement reassures local families seeking high-quality senior care in Mountain Brook, AL, for their loved ones, ensuring that they receive outstanding support tailored to enhance comfort and well-being within their homes. This enduring pledge is in response to the consistent demand from the community for dependable, superior home care solutions, emphasizing the significance of individualized care plans and the holistic welfare of each senior entrusted to their care.
"Pathlight Seniorcare Services stands by its mission to provide exceptional care and support to the seniors of Mountain Brook, ensuring they lead fulfilling lives with dignity and independence," stated Orrett Bailey, owner of Pathlight Seniorcare Services. "Our unwavering dedication to this goal drives us to continually adapt and meet the evolving needs of our community, guaranteeing that each family and senior we serve experience the compassionate, personalized care they truly merit."
Pathlight Seniorcare Services' approach to senior care is deeply personalized, aiming to meet the distinct needs of each client. From essential assistance with daily living activities to addressing comprehensive care requirements, this bespoke approach assures seniors an enhanced quality of life, promoting autonomy, comfort, and overall well-being.
Families in Mountain Brook, AL, searching for exemplary senior care services can turn to Pathlight Seniorcare Services for their loved ones’ needs.
For more information about Pathlight Seniorcare Services and their senior care in Mountain Brook, AL , please visit their website at https://pathlightseniorcare.com
About Pathlight Seniorcare Services, LLC:
Pathlight Seniorcare Services is a leading provider of senior care services in Mountain Brook, AL. Renowned for its commitment to quality and a team of dedicated care professionals, Pathlight Seniorcare Services delivers a wide range of services designed to cater to the varied needs of the senior population. Dedicated to improving the lives of seniors and their families, Pathlight Seniorcare Services continues to be the preferred choice for those seeking compassionate, high-quality care in the comfort of their homes.

author: Peter Fitzpatrick
title: ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡¹ Napoli blow past Fiorentina to seal place in Italian Supercoppa final
text:
OneFootball
Peter Fitzpatrick·18 January 2024
OneFootball
Peter Fitzpatrick·18 January 2024
Napoli kept their hopes of a trophy alive this season with a 3-0 victory over
[Fiorentina](/en/team/fiorentina-15) in the Italian Super Cup semi-final.
Read all about it here.
Scorers: Simeone 22′, Zerbin 84′, 86′
In front of a half-empty Al-Awwal Stadium,
[Fiorentina](/en/team/fiorentina-15) dominated the ball in the opening minutes but struggled to create any chances of note.
Napoli, on the other hand, had less of the ball but more of the attacks, Matteo Politano having his deflected shot tipped over the bar by Pietro Terracciano.
The Serie A champions took the lead in the 22nd minute with a quite brilliant goal. Khvicha Kvaratskhelia showed great strenght to hold off
[Fiorentina](/en/team/fiorentina-15) defender Nikola Milenković and flick the ball onto Juan Jesus.
The Brazilian then played the ball towards Giovanni Simeone, who beat Terracciano with an angled drive.
La
[Viola](/en/team/fiorentina-15), and Jonathan Ikoné to be specific, wasted a golden opportunity to draw level right before half-time. The French forward won a penalty for his side after being fouled by Mario Rui, but proceeded to fire the ball high over the bar from 12 yards out.
The second half was much of the same with
[Fiorentina](/en/team/fiorentina-15) having most of the ball but not truly threatening the [Napoli](/en/team/napoli-191) defence.
Napoli sealed the win and their place in the Super Cup final with two late goals from substitute Alessio Zerbin, who only came on in the 82nd minute.
On 84 minutes, a Giovanni Di Lorenzo corner was flicked onto the backpost where the striker was on hand to stretch out and finish, before crashing into the post.
He dusted himself down to put the game to bed two minutes later, finishing with a low drilled shot after being played into position.
Napoli will find out their final opponents when Inter Milan and Lazio face off tomorrow in the other semi-final.

author: Sandra Issa
title: Your Turn: Letter to a drug dealer
text:
Your Turn: Letter to a drug dealer
photo by: Contributed
To a drug dealer:
I’m not sure what leads someone in life to become a drug dealer. I assume it is greed. I certainly don’t know what leads someone to become a dealer of fentanyl, a drug that inevitably and undeniably ultimately leads to death. There is no way around it — if you are a dealer of fentanyl, you are no longer just a dealer of drugs; you are a dealer of death. Fatalities from fentanyl can occur at only 3 nanograms per milliliter of blood. A user takes a portion of a pill — a portion — and ends up with 13 nanograms of fentanyl in their system. A child dies. That pill would have killed them three or four times over. That child didn’t stand a chance.
A dealer of death. How does someone set themselves up as a dealer of death? If they aren’t feeding their own addiction, I can only imagine they are lying to themselves. Are you lying to yourself? Do you tell yourself that it’s not your responsibility? That, since you didn’t shove a pill down anyone’s throat, it’s not your problem? Maybe you tell yourself, “I didn’t even know this kid. Never saw them in my life. Never talked to them. They’re the one who bought the pill and swallowed it.” But, you know, that child couldn’t have bought that pill if it wasn’t available. And who made that pill available? You did. I wonder how many other people have died because of you, died because you prey on people with substance-use disorders.
It’s been close to four years now since a child died, sprawled face down, half on their bed, half off, looking like they were asleep — except for the fact that their skin had a purple tinge. And if you had gently laid your hand on their arm, you would have found it icy to the touch. How strange! Colder than the air conditioning in the room. That was the first clue. You have children. But have you ever touched a dead child’s arm? Have you ever touched a dead child’s back which is hard and stiff with rigor mortis? That is when the realization finally sets in. No, they are not just asleep. They are gone. All that is left, thanks to you, is pain and grief.
When your fentanyl killed a child, a lot of people suffered. This child had family and friends, teachers and coaches. In their short time on Earth, they touched many people’s lives. And now these people are angry. They do not want fentanyl on the streets of Lawrence, Kansas. They do not want you on the streets of Lawrence, Kansas, if you are selling fentanyl.
I don’t know what hope there is for you. Are you so greedy or unimaginative or untalented that you can do nothing else with your life but sell drugs? That would, indeed, be sad — sad for you and devastating for the rest of us. Can you change your ways? Your track record isn’t promising. If I were a praying person, I would pray that you find salvation or at least train yourself for a new vocation. Unless you can do that, what seems evident is that more people will die. More children will die. And you will be responsible. Do you want to take that to the grave with you?
— Sandra Issa is the mother of a Lawrence teenager who died of a fentanyl overdose. She’s the author of ‘A Terrible and True Tale of Our Time,’ a book for young people about drugs and addiction.
